forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny, with a high near 60. Southwest wind around 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers likely after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 53. South southwest wind around 12 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco this afternoon, the day unfolds under a mostly sunny sky, the sun casting a warm glow across the city as a gentle southwest breeze meanders through the streets. Yet, as the sun descends, a shift is anticipated, bringing with it a hint of the evening's promise. By nightfall, clouds will roll in, with rain showers likely making their appearance past 11 PM. The day's warmth will give way to a cooler embrace, inviting residents to wrap themselves in layers for comfort as they navigate the transition from day to night.

Though the sun shines brightly now, hints of an encroaching marine layer may linger along the coast, suggesting a potential haziness that obscures distant vistas. A light jacket or sweater would serve well against the chilly breeze that lingers through the evening, especially if one finds oneself outdoors, enjoying the city’s vibrant scenes or a leisurely walk along the waterfront. This serene afternoon offers the perfect backdrop for simple pleasures—perhaps a stroll through a local park, with the allure of the evening rain serving as a reminder to seek out the warmth of a cozy café later on.
